Quick Rotisserie Chicken Salad

Jump to Recipe

Looking for a quick and delicious meal that packs a nutritious punch? This Quick Rotisserie Chicken Salad is the perfect solution for busy weeknights or a refreshing lunch option. Made with tender, shredded rotisserie chicken, vibrant mixed salad greens, and a medley of fresh vegetables like cherry tomatoes and cucumber, this salad is not only easy to prepare but also bursting with flavor. Drizzled with a zesty olive oil and lemon dressing, it's a satisfying dish that can be enjoyed on its own or as a side. Whether you're a health-conscious eater or simply craving a light and tasty meal, this recipe is sure to become a staple in your kitchen. Plus, using rotisserie chicken saves you time without sacrificing taste! Let's dive into how to whip up this delightful salad in just a few simple steps.

Ingredients

rotisserie chicken

Use leftover rotisserie chicken for convenience. If you don’t have rotisserie chicken, you can substitute with cooked chicken breast or thighs. For extra flavor, consider seasoning the chicken with garlic powder or smoked paprika after shredding.

mixed salad greens

Opt for a variety of greens like arugula, spinach, or romaine for different textures and flavors. If you don’t have mixed greens, use any leafy greens you have on hand. To enhance flavor, try adding fresh herbs such as parsley or basil.

cherry tomatoes

For sweetness, choose ripe cherry tomatoes. If unavailable, substitute with grape tomatoes or diced regular tomatoes. To enhance their flavor, consider roasting them before adding to the salad.

cucumber

Pick a firm cucumber for crunch; English cucumbers have fewer seeds and a thinner skin, making them ideal. If you don’t have cucumbers, zucchini can be a fresh alternative. Add a sprinkle of salt to draw out moisture and enhance flavor.

red onion

Soak thinly sliced red onion in cold water for 10 minutes before adding to the salad to mellow the sharpness. If you prefer a milder flavor, substitute with green onions or shallots.

olive oil

Use high-quality extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor. For a twist, try infused oils like garlic or lemon. If you’re looking for a lighter option, substitute with avocado oil or a vinaigrette.

lemon juice

Freshly squeezed lemon juice is best for a bright flavor. If you don’t have lemons, lime juice or apple cider vinegar can work as a substitute. To enhance the dressing, consider adding a teaspoon of Dijon mustard.

salt

Use sea salt or kosher salt for better flavor. Adjust salt to your taste, but remember that some ingredients like rotisserie chicken may already contain salt.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper adds a more robust flavor than pre-ground. For a twist, consider using white pepper or a spice blend like lemon pepper for additional zest.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Chicken

    Take your rotisserie chicken and shred it into bite-sized pieces. You can use your hands or two forks to make this easier. Make sure to remove the skin if you prefer a healthier option.

  • Step 2: Combine the Greens and Vegetables

    In a large mixing bowl, add 4 cups of mixed salad greens. Then, toss in 1 cup of halved cherry tomatoes, 1 diced cucumber, and 1/4 cup of thinly sliced red onion. This combination of fresh ingredients provides a variety of textures and flavors.

  • Step 3: Add the Shredded Chicken

    Once your vegetables are well mixed, gently add the shredded rotisserie chicken on top of the salad mixture. This not only adds protein to your salad but also makes it more filling.

  • Step 4: Make the Dressing

    In a small bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Whisk together until the mixture is well combined and emulsified.

  • Step 5: Dress the Salad

    Drizzle the dressing over the salad. Use just enough to coat the ingredients without drowning them. Toss the salad gently to combine, ensuring everything is evenly coated with the dressing.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I properly shred rotisserie chicken?

To shred rotisserie chicken, use two forks to pull the meat apart into bite-sized pieces. Start by removing the skin if you prefer a lighter salad, and then work your way from the breast and thighs, pulling the meat into shreds.

What type of salad greens should I use?

You can use any mixed salad greens you like! Popular choices include romaine, spinach, arugula, or a pre-mixed salad blend. Choose greens that are fresh and crisp for the best texture.

How do I cut cherry tomatoes?

To cut cherry tomatoes, place them on a cutting board and slice them in half lengthwise. If you have a lot to cut, you can stack them and slice through them horizontally for efficiency.

What is the best way to dice a cucumber?

To dice a cucumber, first wash it thoroughly. Cut off both ends, and then slice it in half lengthwise. Place the halves flat side down and slice them into half-moon shapes, then turn and cut across the pieces to create small cubes.

Why is it important to slice onion thinly?

Thinly slicing onions allows them to mix well with other salad ingredients and ensures that their flavor is evenly distributed throughout the salad. It also helps to reduce the sharpness of the onion.

How do I know how much salt and pepper to add?

Start with a small pinch of salt and a couple of cracks of pepper. Toss the salad, taste it, and adjust as needed. Remember, you can always add more, but you can’t take it out once it’s in!

Can I make the dressing ahead of time?

Yes! You can whisk the olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper together and store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week. Just give it a shake before using.

What’s a good way to toss the salad without making a mess?

To toss the salad gently, use a pair of tongs or two large spoons. Lift the salad from the bottom and turn it over on top of itself rather than stirring vigorously, which can bruise the greens.

Is it safe to eat the chicken cold?

Yes, rotisserie chicken is already cooked, so it's perfectly safe to eat cold in your salad. Just make sure it has been stored properly in the fridge if you have leftovers.

How can I add more protein to this salad?

If you want to add more protein, consider including ingredients like chickpeas, boiled eggs, or nuts such as almonds or walnuts. These will enhance the nutrition and flavor of your salad.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This salad is naturally gluten-free and can be adapted for dairy-free diets by ensuring the dressing ingredients are free from dairy. For a low-carb option, you can substitute the mixed greens with spiralized zucchini or cauliflower rice. Vegan eaters can replace the rotisserie chicken with chickpeas or marinated tofu for protein.

Pairings

For a delightful pairing with the Quick Rotisserie Chicken Salad, consider serving it alongside crusty whole-grain bread or a fresh baguette. A light white wine such as Sauvignon Blanc or a refreshing sparkling water with a hint of lemon would complement the salad beautifully. For a heartier option, grilled shrimp or a side of quinoa can add protein and texture.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the salad in chilled bowls to enhance the fresh, crisp flavors. Garnish with freshly chopped herbs like parsley or dill for added color and flavor. For a bit of crunch, sprinkle some toasted nuts or seeds on top just before serving. This dish is perfect for a casual lunch or a light dinner, and can be elevated for a gathering by serving it on a large platter with decorative edible flowers or citrus slices.

#

Quick Rotisserie Chicken Salad

10 min
$10
250 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

None

Dietary Tags:

Gluten-FreeHigh Protein

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Main CourseSalad

Tags:

SaladQuick MealHealthy

Description

A refreshing and easy salad made with tender rotisserie chicken, crunchy veggies, and a light dressing.

Ingredients

  • rotisserie chicken: 2 cups, shredded
  • mixed salad greens: 4 cups
  • cherry tomatoes: 1 cup, halved
  • cucumber: 1, diced
  • red onion: 1/4 cup, thinly sliced
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • lemon juice: 1 tablespoon
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

Date Created:

11/18/2024
